text: In that case ppl wouldnt be able to see my order up until the market closes right? I kinda want others to see my order as that way they could balance out the imbalance i created (i dont actually use it to make a profit, only to reduce variance), which would profit me

text: If you use market_on_close then yes the order is a live order until the auction and would show up in the order book. I'm not actually 100% on the behaviour of the limit_on_close type as I've never used it, but I think that would go directly into the auction with no ability to change it and would feature in the SP estimates, but not in the order book...however I suspect <@U4H19D1D2> is better placed to answer this than me as I vaguely remember him saying he does place SP orders

text:
<@UNQGKT0CR> Thats how i understood it aswell, thanks for confirming :slightly_smiling_face: However, what am i doing wrong here?
```trade = flumine.order.trade.Trade(
                                    market_id=market_id, 
                                    selection_id=selection_id,
                                    handicap=handicap,
                                    strategy=self
                                )

                                liability = - matched_quantity      # this is > 2
                                order = trade.create_order(
                                            side="BACK", 
                                            order_type=flumine.order.order.MarketOnCloseOrder(liability=liability)
                                        )

                                self.place_order(market, order)```
what am i missing here? It wont place the order, all variables seem correct.

```{"asctime": "2020-12-04 17:43:32,949", "levelname": "CRITICAL", "message": "Unknown error 'MarketOnCloseOrder' object has no attribute 'size' in strategy_process_market_book <bound method MyStrat.process_market_book of <strategy_object object at 0x7f7981f08dd0>> 1.176351611", "exc_info": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/order/order.py\", line 391, in size_remaining\n

    return self.current_order.size_remaining or 0.0\n

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'size_remaining'\n

\n

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:\n

\n

Traceback (most recent call last):\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/utils.py\", line 208, in call_process_market_book\n

    strategy_process_market_book(market, market_book)\n

  File \"/home/jenkins-slave-strat/workspace/ProdTest/my_strat.py\", line 208, in process_market_book\n

    self.place_order(market, order)\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/strategy/strategy.py\", line 134, in place_order\n

    market.place_order(order)\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/markets/market.py\", line 53, in place_order\n

    order.place(self.market_book.publish_time)\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/order/order.py\", line 289, in place\n

    self.placing()\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/order/order.py\", line 86, in placing\n

    self._update_status(OrderStatus.PENDING)\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/order/order.py\", line 81, in _update_status\n

    <http://logger.info|logger.info>(\"Order status update: %s\" % self.status.value, extra=<http://self.info|self.info>)\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/order/order.py\", line 266, in info\n

    \"size_remaining\": self.size_remaining,\n

  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flumine/order/order.py\", line 396, in size_remaining\n

    return self.order_type.size\nAttributeError: 'MarketOnCloseOrder' object has no attribute 'size'"}```
For some reason it tries to get the size, which an MarketOnCloseOrder doesnt have

text:
It's Top Power that I am having issues with. It refused the enter the stalls and was declared non runner. I guess Betfair did it later.

However, it had an adjustment factor of 75.18.

In a strategy I am testing, I layed at 3.2.

Applying the adjustment factor, the average price matched drops to 0.79, which is below 1.01 and therefore invalid.

Is 75.18 a valid adjustment factor?

The adjustment factor code is here:

<https://github.com/liampauling/flumine/blob/4f08f389a3c5c2722b60252055b143cfdfefb0f7/flumine/markets/middleware.py#L104-L107>

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

attachments.title: flumine/markets/middleware.py:104-107

elements.text:
It's Top Power that I am having issues with. It refused the enter the stalls and was declared non runner. I guess Betfair did it later.

However, it had an adjustment factor of 75.18.

In a strategy I am testing, I layed at 3.2.

Applying the adjustment factor, the average price matched drops to 0.79, which is below 1.01 and therefore invalid.

Is 75.18 a valid adjustment factor?

The adjustment factor code is here:

text: Adjustment factor is just a percentage so 75% is valid - it must have been a heavy favourite. It is a pain in the arse when you get these late removals but Betfair don't pull them from the runner list prior to the off in time.

elements.text: Adjustment factor is just a percentage so 75% is valid - it must have been a heavy favourite. It is a pain in the arse when you get these late removals but Betfair don't pull them from the runner list prior to the off in time.

text:
If I was matched at decimal odds of 3.2, and the adjustment factor was 75.18, what should the new price be?

From reading this document, I also get 0.79. But how is it possible to get matched at 0.79? 1.01 is the lowest possible odds.

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text:
If I was matched at decimal odds of 3.2, and the adjustment factor was 75.18, what should the new price be?

From reading this document, I also get 0.79. But how is it possible to get matched at 0.79? 1.01 is the lowest possible odds.

text: <https://en-betfair.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/408/~/exchange%3A-in-a-horse-race%2C-how-will-non-runners-be-treated%3F>

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

text: They match and deduct afterwards, so will be a number that is not an exact betfair increment. BSP is never an exact increment, although it is within the range 1.01-1000.

elements.text: They match and deduct afterwards, so will be a number that is not an exact betfair increment. BSP is never an exact increment, although it is within the range 1.01-1000.
